meanings.definition: A group to which one does not belong.
meanings.sent1: In the school, the outgroups often ate lunch together.
meanings.sent2: The outgroups in the community were not invited to the event.
meanings.sent3: The outgroups decided to start their own club for unique hobbies.
meanings.sent4: She felt like an outgroup in the team of experienced players.
meanings.sent5: The outgroups stood out with their colorful outfits.

meanings.definition: Those who are perceived as different or inferior.
meanings.sent1: The outgroups were often excluded from social gatherings.
meanings.sent2: She felt like one of the outgroups due to her unconventional ideas.
meanings.sent3: The outgroups were the stars of the talent show with their quirky acts.
meanings.sent4: He saw himself as part of the outgroups, not fitting into the mainstream.
meanings.sent5: The outgroups were always the first to try new things in the neighborhood.
